title: Understanding Research Proposal Sections
text: A research proposal typically includes several key sections that outline the research plan. These sections help in organizing the research process and ensuring that all necessary components are addressed.

title: Common Sections in a Research Proposal
text: Some common sections in a research proposal include the introduction, literature review, methodology, and analysis. Each section serves a specific purpose in outlining the research plan.

title: Identifying the Odd One Out
text: Consider which option does not fit the typical structure of a research proposal. Think about the purpose of each section and whether it contributes to the research plan.

title: Analyzing the Options
text: Review the options: Criticisms, Problem Statement, Methodology, and Analysis. Which one does not typically appear as a section in a research proposal?
